com.zumobi.zbim

Class ZBiM

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.zumobi.zbim.ZBiM

  • public final class ZBiM
extends java.lang.Object
    This singleton class exposes all of the public capabilities of the ZBiM SDK
    See Also:
    zbim-sdk-android

      • generateDefaultUserID

        public java.lang.String generateDefaultUserID()
        Generates a new user ID that application can use to set as the active user ID. This is typically used when the application has (internally) no notion of a user or does not want to share it with the SDK.
        Returns:
        String representing the newly generated user ID.

      • getActiveUser

        public java.lang.String getActiveUser()

        Returns:
        String representing the current active user ID.

      • setActiveUser

        public void setActiveUser(java.lang.String userID)
                   throws ZBiMStateException
        Sets the active user on whose behalf SDK will perform work and whose actions it will track.
        Parameters:
        userID - User ID to be set as the current active user.
        Throws:
        ZBiMStateException

      • createUser

        public void createUser(java.lang.String userID,
                       java.lang.String[] tags)
        Creates a user. Can be set as current active user and have SDK do work on user's behalf.
        Parameters:
        userID - The desired userID to use for this new user. Can be generated by generateDefaultUserID().
        tags - The initial set of tags describing the new user. The set can change as the user consumes content.

      • getTagsForUser

        public java.lang.String[] getTagsForUser(java.lang.String userID)
        Parameters:
        userID - The user ID to get tags for.
        Returns:
        An array of tags associated with the given user.

      • getTagUsageCountsForUser

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Long> getTagUsageCountsForUser(java.lang.String userID)
        Returns a mapping between each tag associated with the given user and the number of times the user has consumed content annotated with the given tag.
        Parameters:
        userID - Identifier for the user that tag counts are being queried for.
        Returns:
        Mapping of tags to corresponding usage counts.

      • updateTagUsageCounts

        public void updateTagUsageCounts(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> tags)
                          throws ZBiMStateException
        Updates existing tag usage counts for current active user.
        Parameters:
        tags - A tag/magnitude mapping specifying by how much the corresponding tag count should be incremented/decremented. If usage count drops to zero (or lower) then the tag is deleted. If a tag is not already part of a the current active user's profile then if magnitude is greater than 0, then the tag is added with the magnitude as the usage count. If the magnitude is less than or equal to 0, then the entry for that particular tag is ignored.
        Throws:
        ZBiMStateException

      • getColorScheme

        public ZBiMColorScheme getColorScheme()
        Gets the current color scheme of the SDK.
        Returns:
        A ZBiMColorScheme object.

      • setColorScheme

        public void setColorScheme(ZBiMColorScheme colorScheme)
        Sets the color scheme of the SDK to the new value. Change takes effect on next ContentHub launch.
        Parameters:
        colorScheme - The new color scheme.

      • isDownloadingContent

        public boolean isDownloadingContent()
        Checks whether the SDK is currently downloading content.
        Returns:
        True if it is, false otherwise.

      • isDisplayingContentHub

        public boolean isDisplayingContentHub()
        Checks whether the Content Hub is currently on screen in some form, e.g. showing content, error message or download progress indicator.
        Returns:
        True if it is, false otherwise.

      • isReady

        public boolean isReady()
        Checks whether the Content Hub is ready to present content.
        Returns:
        True if it is, false otherwise.

      • isDisabled

        public boolean isDisabled()
        Checks whether the SDK has been disabled (typically due to security considerations), and cannot be used to present content to the user.
        Returns:
        True if it is, false otherwise.

                              throws ZBiMStateException
        Launches a Content Hub as a full-screen Activity.
        Throws:

      • launchContentHubActivity

        public void launchContentHubActivity(java.lang.String uri)
                              throws ZBiMStateException,
                                     java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Launches a Content Hub as an Activity, loading a spcific piece of content.
        Parameters:
        uri - Identifies the piece of content to be loaded in the newly created Content Hub.
        Throws:
        ZBiMStateException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • launchContentHubActivity

        public void launchContentHubActivity(java.lang.String[] tags)
                              throws ZBiMStateException,
                                     java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Launches a Content Hub as an Activity, loading a piece of content that best matches the given set of tags.
        Parameters:
        tags - A list of tags to be used when selecting a hub page to load. The parameter is applicable only when there are multiple hub pages to choose from. By default the hub page that matches the set of tags associated with the current user is chosen. This method allows overriding this behavior by passing a different set of tags. Tag usage counts are deliberately not used here (two flat lists of tags compared against each other to select the best matching hub page).
        Throws:
        ZBiMStateException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getContentHubFragment

        public ContentHubFragment getContentHubFragment(java.lang.String strUri)
        Get a Fragment containing a ContentHub. This can then be added to another activity as a sub view. Typically used when the application wants to have full control over the navigation chrome.
        Parameters:
        strUri - A URI identifying the piece of content to be loaded into the newly created fragment. If strUri is null, the hub that best matches current user tags will be selected.
        Returns:
        A Fragment that can be then incorporated into a parent view.

      • setContentHubBackgroundColor

        public void setContentHubBackgroundColor(int color)
        Sets the Content Hub's background color.
        Parameters:
        color, - for example Color.BLACK.

      • whitelistScheme

        public void whitelistScheme(java.lang.String scheme)
        Registers a custom URI scheme.
        Parameters:
        scheme - URI scheme to be registered.

      • setLoggingHandler

        public void setLoggingHandler(ZBiMLogging loggingHandler)
        Sets an object to be used as the logging handler for the ZBiM SDK. All messages from the SDK will go into this handler.
        Parameters:
        loggingHandler - An object implementing the ZBiMLogging interface.

      • getLoggingHandler

        public ZBiMLogging getLoggingHandler()
        Gets the current logging handler.
        Returns:
        The current logging handler.

      • setAdvertiserID

        public void setAdvertiserID(java.lang.String adId)
        Provides a way for the client application to override the current advertising identifier.
        Parameters:
        adId - An advertising identifier to be used in place of the one supplied by the device.

      • generateContentWidgets

        public void generateContentWidgets(java.lang.String resourceType,
                                   int maxCount,
                                   java.lang.String[] tags,
                                   boolean contentTailoringEnabled,
                                   ContentWidgetQueryResultListener contentWidgetQueryResultListener)
        Gets a list of content widgets matching the criteria defined by the method's parameters. The result is obtained asynchronously via ContentFragmentQueryResultListener's methods.
        Parameters:
        resourceType - can be RESOURCE_TYPE_ARTICLE, RESOURCE_TYPE_CHANNEL or RESOURCE_TYPE_HUB.
        maxCount - 0 for unlimited, otherwise an integer greater than 0 to limit the number of results.
        tags - Set of tags to be used when ordering the content widgets. If null, the tags associated with current active user are used.
        contentTailoringEnabled - If false, content is shown in the order it appears in the content DB, otherwise content is sorted according to set of tags associated with current active user.
        contentWidgetQueryResultListener - Object implementing callback methods to be used to report task completion.

      • setContentWidgetDelegate

        public void setContentWidgetDelegate(ContentWidgetDelegate delegate)
        To show the Content Widget in a fragment, a delegate must be set NOTE: be sure to clean up after the Fragment Activity is closed by setting setContentWidgetDelegate(null) For an implementation example, see ActivityFragmentHub.java
        Parameters:
        delegate - concrete implementation of the interface
        See Also:
        ContentWidgetDelegate

      • selectContentWidget

        public void selectContentWidget(ContentWidget widget)
        Once a user has selected a Content Widget, notify ZBiM so that it can show it in a fragment later NOTE: be sure to clean up after the Fragment Activity is closed by setting selectContentWidget(null) For an example, see ActivityFragmentHub.onDestroy()
        Parameters:
        widget - ContentFragment
        See Also:
        ContentWidget

      • getSelectedContentWidget

        public ContentWidget getSelectedContentWidget()
        When launching the Fragment Activity, used to obtain the previously selected content widget For an example, see ActivityFragmentHub.onCreate()
        Returns:
        ContentWidget
